senses.de: Opposed to great or sudden social change; showing that you prefer traditional styles and values.

Tips.title: Political Stance
Tips.description: Often relates to political ideology favouring traditional values and established institutions.
Tips.example: His conservative stance is reflected in his political voting.

Tips.title: Resistant to Change
Tips.description: Can suggest reluctance to adopt new policies or progressive trends in society.
Tips.example: The conservative viewpoint resists changing the established school curriculum.

Tips.title: Cultural Preferences
Tips.description: May refer to a preference for classical or traditional art, music, and literature.
Tips.example: She has a conservative taste in music, preferring classical over modern genres.

senses.de: Used to describe a person who carefully manages resources, like money or energy, and avoids waste.
senses.ex: She's conservative with her money, preferring to save rather than spend.

Tips.title: Budget Wise
Tips.description: Suggests careful planning and allocation of resources to avoid unnecessary expenditure.
Tips.example: Their conservative budget allowed them to save for future investments.

Tips.title: Risk-averse
Tips.description: Implies being cautious and avoiding risky decisions, especially financially.
Tips.example: Her conservative financial choices protected her from the market crash.

senses.de: A person who is averse to change and holds to traditional values and attitudes, typically in relation to politics.
senses.ex: My aunt is a staunch Conservative and will never vote for a liberal party.

Tips.title: Not Political 'liberal'
Tips.description: Indicates a person who does not align with political liberalism.
Tips.example: As a conservative, he often debates against liberal policies.

Tips.title: Traditional Morals
Tips.description: May imply adherence to traditional social norms and moral values.
Tips.example: He's conservative in his lifestyle, upholding family traditions.

senses.de: A member or supporter of a Conservative Party, especially the one existing in the UK.
senses.ex: The Conservatives won the last general election.

Tips.title: Specific Party
Tips.description: Specific to supporters of the UK's Conservative Party, not conservatives in general.
Tips.example: She canvasses for the Conservatives every election.

Tips.title: Context-Dependent
Tips.description: In a UK context, it always refers to the Conservative Party, not to conservative ideology.
Tips.example: The Conservatives' policies differ from those of other UK parties.

Conventional.wordDefinition:
Conventional refers to a practice or idea that is widely accepted or used by society. It is based on an established set of rules or norms and may not necessarily be traditional or conservative.

Conventional ideas are applicable in fields like science, engineering, and technology, where widely accepted practices are followed to achieve certain outcomes.

Conservative means sticking to traditional beliefs, and conventional means following generally accepted practices.

Orthodox.wordDefinition:
Orthodox means someone who adheres strictly to established beliefs or doctrines, especially in religion or politics.

It can also be applicable in different areas such as culture, philosophy, or medicine. For example, an orthodox Christian would follow the traditional teachings of the Bible, while an orthodox physician would adhere to established medical practices and procedures.

Reactionary.wordDefinition:
Reactionary is a more extreme form of conservatism that seeks to return society to a previous, often idealized state. They are opposed to social or political change, and can be militant in their opposition to perceived threats to their beliefs.

In practical terms, conservatism might mean supporting lower taxes and limited government interference in the economy, while reactionary beliefs might include opposing marriage equality or racial integration.

Generally, conservatism is a more moderate and mainstream political ideology, while reactionaries are often viewed as fringe or radical.

Regressive.wordDefinition:
Regressive, on the other hand, refers to policies, movements, or ideas that seek to return to a less advanced or progressive state.

In simple terms, being conservative means wanting to maintain what exists, while being regressive means wanting to reverse the progress that has been made.

Republican.wordDefinition:
Republican refers to a political party in the United States that aligns with conservative values, but also supports specific policies and candidates.

Conservative is a broader term that can be applied to individuals or groups with a particular belief system, while Republican is a specific political organization.

Retrogressive.wordDefinition:
Retrogressive means becoming less advanced or progressive, going back in time or reversing progress.

In simpler terms, conservative means wanting to keep things the same, while retrogressive means going backwards.

Tory.wordDefinition:
On the other hand, Tory is a specific term used to refer to members of the Conservative Party in the UK. It has historical roots and is often used in the context of British politics.

Conservative is a broader term that describes a political ideology, while Tory refers specifically to members of the Conservative Party in the UK.

Traditional.wordDefinition:
Traditional refers to something that has been done a certain way for a long time, usually because of cultural or historical reasons.

While there is some overlap between the two words, conservative is more about resisting change and traditional is more about following established practices.

Each one can be applicable depending on the context. For example, a conservative politician might want to maintain existing laws and policies, while someone who values traditional family structures might prioritize marriage and gender roles.

quotes.Text: Liberals are always proposing perfectly insane ideas, laws that will make everybody happy, laws that will make everything right, make us live forever, and all be rich. Conservatives are never that stupid.
quotes.Title: American Comedian
quotes.Name: P. J. O'Rourke

quotes.Text: I live a pretty conservative life, so I probably really haven't done anything crazy.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Michael Phelps

quotes.Text: I'm actually a fairly conservative person. I live a very conservative lifestyle.
quotes.Title: American Activist
quotes.Name: Michael Moore

quotes.Text: I'm conservative. I was raised conservative, and that's the way I will vote.
quotes.Title: American Model
quotes.Name: Kim Alexis

quotes.Text: A conservative is one who admires radicals centuries after they're dead.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Leo Rosten

quotes.Text: By trying to advance the perfect conservative solution, nobody wins.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Bill Flores

quotes.Text: The truth is, I am conservative, but socially, I'm very liberal.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Dean Cain

quotes.Text: I do think it's possible to have a conservative personality.
quotes.Title: American Public Servant
quotes.Name: Stephen Miller

quotes.Text: I think my parents see my life now as very conservative.
quotes.Title: Australian Actress
quotes.Name: Radha Mitchell
